meanings.definition: A person who despises or looks down on others.
meanings.sent1: The despisers in the group always made fun of people who were different.
meanings.sent2: The teacher talked to the despisers about being kind to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The despisers at the party thought they were better than everyone else.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as a despiser of injustice, always standing up for what was right.
meanings.sent5: The despisers in the story were eventually shown the value of kindness and empathy.

meanings.definition: Those who hold contempt or scorn for something or someone.
meanings.sent1: The despisers of modern art refused to visit the new exhibit.
meanings.sent2: The despisers of change resisted any new ideas in the company.
meanings.sent3: The despisers of spicy food wrinkled their noses at the sight of hot peppers.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were filled with fire as she faced the despisers of her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The despisers of hard work soon realized the value of dedication and perseverance.
